titleStmt.title: A Transcription of the Yasna in Y_Y_451_T54_9

respStmt.resp: Data entry and TEI markup by
respStmt.name: Mehrbod Khanizadeh

distributor.name: Corpus Avesticum: Digital Yasna (CoAv)
School of Oriental and African Studies (SOAS)
University of London (UCL)

availability.p: Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) Available for re-use under a creative commons license provided attribution is made to the original creators

projectDesc.p: This transcription was made by the Multimedia Yasna Project.

editorialDecl.p: This transcription was made using the MUYA OTE.

ab.note: Above hāuu, a sign like the Avestan a or Pahlavi alif is written in red ink.
Above āta, a sign like the Avestan a or Pahlavi alif is written in red ink.
Above ādiǝm, a sign like the Avestan a or Pahlavi alif is written in red ink.
Above the word, a sign like the Avestan a or Pahlavi alif is written in red ink.
Above āmą̇, a sign like the Avestan a or Pahlavi alif is written in red ink.
A dot in red ink occurs over m.
Above ao, a sign like the Avestan a or Pahlavi alif is written in red ink.
Two big dots in red ink occur above the line i.e. one dot above c in cit̰ and the second one above the separating dot after the word.
Above āat̰, a sign like the Avestan a or Pahlavi alif is written in red ink.
Above kasә, a sign like the Avestan a or Pahlavi alif is written in red ink.
It seems that i is written over an illegible character.
Above āat̰, a Pahlavi sign like the Avestan a or Pahlavi alif is written in red ink.

Another ϑ is written above the crossed out orginal one. The second ϑ is probably given to confirm the original one whose shape is slightly different from the standard sign for ϑ.
